result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle E. PETERSON

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in these charges, the defendant entered a plea in Case File 14 CF 381.  Motion granted.  
$50.00 cash bail transferred to Case File 14 CF 381.  
$142.00 cash bail from 14 CF 381 used to pay restitution to Wisconsin Aluminum Foundry.   
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea Date set for 01-15-15.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 10-08-14 at 9:30 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 09-04-14 at 8:30 a.m.  
Minutes.
Defendant requests counsel.  Initial appearance is reset to 07-28-14 at 2:30 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle E. PETERSON
Current: 400 Reed Avenue #7, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 07-10-2014)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220

$50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts bail jumping and felony theft.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-14-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with James Hatt, Wisconsin Aluminum Foundry and Micah Hammond.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
